alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:38PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Wasatch... southern Morgan and southwestern Summit Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 138 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Francis, or near Heber City, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Park City, Heber City, Heber, Summit Park, Kamas, Oakley, Francis, Daniel, Wanship, South Snyderville Basin, North Snyderville Basin, Samak, Timber Lakes, Midway, Wallsburg, Peoa, Woodland, Trial Lk, Marion and Hailstone. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 145 and 155. US Route 40 between mile markers 0 and 32. Utah Route 35 between mile markers 0 and 21. Mirror Lake Highway between mile markers 0 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains
